## GAD-7 vs ASSIST

Working with psychometric tests such as the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Alcohol, Smoking, and Substance Involvement Screening Test (ASSIST) can be an arduous task for psychologists and social scientists. The issues of harmonisation and comparison often consume a significant amount of time and resources. This is where digital tools like Harmony come to play in  GAD-7 vs ASSIST. Harmony is a path-breaking software tool favoured by researchers for its capabilities in harmonising questionnaire items, even in different languages, using natural language processing and generative AI models. It allows psychologists to effectively compare GAD-7 and ASSIST and helps in determining a percentage match between each item. This aids in assessing whether results are consistent across studies, or vary with shifting social circumstances. With Harmony, the task of harmonisation when comparing GAD-7 vs ASSIST becomes a seamless process rather than a laborious task. In the digital age, any psychologist considering a comparative study on GAD-7 vs ASSIST would find Harmony to be an indispensable tool. With its user-friendly interface, you can simply drag and drop your instruments in PDF form or select from Harmony's comprehensive database. Its multilingual feature only further adds to the convenience and accuracy of its comparisons. Trust Harmony to simplify your research like never before.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and ASSIST

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_In1dfV0=" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and ASSIST into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_In1dfV0=" target="harmonyapp">Import just ASSIST into Harmony</a> - compare ASSIST with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
